rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66785

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to a comparator against which the study treatment is evaluated.
name: Control Type Response

terms.definition: A type of control, which has a demonstrated effect, administered as a comparator to subjects in a clinical trial. [From ICH E10]
A type of control using different doses or regimens of the same treatment across the treatment arms.
No person or thing, nobody, not any. (NCI)
An inactive, identical-appearing drug or treatment that does not contain the test product.
A type of negative control in which a procedure is performed that mimics the procedure under study but does not include investigational processes or components.
